"When Saul's son heard that Abner was dead in Hebron, his hands were feeble, and all the Israelites were troubled." It was 
                                                                           701
evident that the kingdom could not long be maintained. Soon another act of treachery completed the downfall of the waning power. Ishbosheth was foully murdered by two of his captains, who, cutting off his head, hastened with it to the king of Judah, hoping thus to ingratiate themselves in his favor.
